intro: Daviesia hakeoides, commonly known as the Hakea-like Daviesia, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Daviesia hakeoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
